title: Is colourless actually a colour? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my opinion white and black and grey are colours, albeit achromatic ones. Of course, whether you agree with me all depends upon how you define the word colour, which turns out to be not as simple as one might first imagine. Regarding colourless, I don’t know. If we took something like a small glass of water where the water is totally transparent. Most people would say that the water is colourless. Does it have a colour? Probably not.

Yes. There is nothing we can “see” which is colorless. There are things which are colorless, but we can’t see them yet. It may not be so long before this will be a fact, because there is so much being learned about the brain, and how it commands the rest of our being, including sight. For instance, it has just recently become a reality for color blind to “see” colors with invented equipment, and even, in a few cases, for truly “blind” to see, despite the trauma to their eyes.
